title: Bullocky
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australia - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/New South Wales
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Timber - Australia
abstract: Vic Deaves is a bullocky, one of the last of his kind. With his team of bullocks he drags logs out of the valley too choked and precipitous for mechanised transport.
description: Vic Deaves is a fourth generation bushman. For as long as he can remember, his family has lived in and off the Australian bush, often as timber-getters in the coastal valleys of New South Wales. Vic is a bullocky, one of the last of his kind. In this film Vic talks about his life and work, his bullocks and his friends. The area where he works is very much a part of another Australia, now past, but Vic and his surroundings represent the best of it.
